newsitem.title: USA: Indianapolis arena, convention bills head to Gov..
newsitem.headline: Indianapolis arena, convention bills head to Gov..

text.p: - Bills to help finance a new arena for the Indiana Pacers basketball team and to expand Indianapolis' convention center are on their way to Gov. Frank O'Bannon.
The Indiana Senate on Monday and Tuesday passed the bills, which were approved earlier this month by the House, according to the Seante Republican majority communications office.
A spokesman for O'Bannon said the governor would review the bills once they get to his desk.

One bill would create a professional sports development district in downtown Indianapolis and allow the city to use an estimated $5 million in annual sales and income taxes generated in the district to back bonds for a $175 million arena.
The other bill would allow Indianapolis to increase its hotel-motel and rental car taxes and expand the application of a ticket tax to fund a $40 million expansion of the convention center.
